alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 8:34PM EST until December 24 at 4:17PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Oxford, Sagadahoc, Somerset, Waldo and York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM EST, Up to 3 inches of rain has fallen in some places, and additional runoff is expected overnight. - Even though the rain has ended, some small creeks and streams will continue to rise until after midnight, before they start to recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, Rochester, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Augusta, Westbrook, and Waterville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
